1.text: And Adam knew Life, his wife, and she will conceive and bear Cain, and said, I obtained a man of Jehovah.

2.text: And she will add to bear his brother Abel; and Abel shall be a feeder of sheep, and Cain was a laborer of the earth.

3.text: And it shall be at the end of days, and Cain shall bring in from the fruit of the earth an offering to Jehovah.

4.text: And Abel, he also brought in the first-born of his sheep, and their fat. And Jehovah will look to Abel and to his gift.

5.text: And to Cain and to his offering he looked not: and Cain will be very angry, and his countenance will fall.

6.text: And Jehovah will say to Cain, Why art thou angry, and why does thy countenance fall?

7.text: If thou shalt do well thou shalt be lifted up; and if thou shalt not do well, sin lies at the entrance; and to thee his desire, and thou shalt rule over him.

8.text: And Cain will speak to Abel his brother; and it shall be in their being in the field, Cain will rise up against Abel his brother, and will kill him.

9.text: And Jehovah will say to Cain, Where is Abel thy brother? and he will say, I know not: am I my brother’s watcher?

10.text: And he will say, What didst thou? the voice of thy brother’s bloods, crying out to me from the earth.

11.text: And now cursed art thou, from the earth, which opened her mouth to take thy brother’s bloods from thy hand.

12.text: When thou shalt work the earth she shall not add to give her strength to thee. Wandering and fleeing shalt thou be in the earth.

13.text: And Cain will say to Jehovah, My sin is great, above bearing.

14.text: Lo, thou didst drive me out this day from above the face of the earth, and from thy face shall I be hid; and I shall be wandering and fleeing in the earth; and it shall be, every one finding me will kill me.

15.text: And Jehovah will say to him, Therefore, every one killing Cain, he shall be avenged seven fold. And Jehovah will put a sign upon Cain, lest any finding him, smite him.

16.text: And Cain went out from the face of Jehovah, and dwelt in the land of Nod, eastward of Eden.

17.text: And Cain will know his wife, and she will conceive and bear Enoch: and he will be building a city, and will call the name of the city after the name of his son Enoch.

18.text: And to Enoch shall be born Irad; and Irad begat Mehujael; and Mehujael begat Methusael; and Methusael begat Lamech.

19.text: And Lamech shall take to him two women: the name of the one Adah, and the name of the second, Zillah.

20.text: And Adah will bear Jabal; he was the father of him remaining in the tent, and riches.

21.text: And his brother’s name Jubal; he was father of all laying hold of the harp and pipe.

22.text: And Zillah, she also will bear Tubal Cain, sharpening every cutting instrument of brass and iron: and Tubal Cain’s sister was Naamah.

23.text: And Lamech will say his wives, Adah and Zillah, Hear my voice, ye wives of Lamech, and give ear to my word: for I killed a man to my wound, and a son to my cutting.

24.text: If Cain shall be avenged seven fold, also Lamech seventy and seven.

25.text: And Adam will know his wife again, and she will bear a son, and she will call his name Seth: for God set me a second seed instead of Abel, for Cain slew him.

26.text: And to Seth, to him also a son shall be born, and he will call his name Enos: then it was begun to call in the name of Jehovah.
